get.summary: Get QR code for pairing WhatsApp Web.

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: Return all sessions, including those that are in the STOPPED state.

get.summary: Get information about the authenticated account

post.summary: Send a poll with options. You can use it as buttons replace
Send an image. Either from an URL or base64 data - look at the request schemas for details.
Send a file. Either from an URL or base64 data - look at the request schemas for details.
Send an voice message. Either from an URL or base64 data - look at the request schemas for details.

put.summary: React to a message with an emoji

delete.summary: Clears all messages from the chat

get.summary: Get contact basic info. The method always return result, even if the phone number is not registered in WhatsApp. For that - use /check-exists endpoint below.
Check phone number is registered in WhatsApp.
Gets the Contact's current "about" info. Returns null if you don't have permission to read their status.
Returns the contact's profile picture URL, if privacy settings allow it.

put.summary: Updates the group settings to only allow admins to edit group info (title, description, photo).

Updates the group description.
Returns true if the subject was properly updated. This can return false if the user does not have the necessary permissions.

Updates the group subject.
Returns true if the subject was properly updated. This can return false if the user does not have the necessary permissions.

get.summary: Gets the invite code for a specific group.

post.summary: Invalidates the current group invite code and generates a new one.

get.summary: Get a list of participants by in the group.

post.summary: Adds a list of participants by ID to the group.
Removes a list of participants by ID to the group.
Demotes participants by to regular users.

get.summary: Get the presence for the chat id. If it hasn't been subscribed - it also subscribes to it.

post.summary: Subscribe to presence events for the chat.

info.title: WAHA - WhatsApp HTTP API
info.description:
WhatsApp HTTP API that you can run in a click!
  • Documentation
  • Supported features in engines
  • GitHub - WAHA Core
  • GitHub - WAHA Plus

Support the project and get WAHA Plus version!
  • Patreon
  • Boosty

tags.name: screenshot
tags.description: Get screenshot of WhatsApp and show QR code

tags.name: contacts
tags.description:
Contacts methods.
Use phone number (without +) or phone number and `@c.us` at the end as `contactId`.
'E.g: `12312312310` OR `12312312310@c.us`

protocol.description: The protocol used to access the server.

host.description: The hostname or IP address of the server.

port.description: The port number on which the server is listening for requests

baseUrl.description: The base URL path for all API endpoints. This can be used to group related endpoints together under a common path.

phoneNumber.description: Mobile phone number in international format

method.description: How would you like to receive the one time code for registration? |sms|voice. Leave empty for Web pairing.

logout.description: Stop and logout from the session.

mentions.description: Mention contact in the message. The message MUST contain '@123456789' text in order to work with 'mentions' field.

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp for when the message was created

from.description: ID for the Chat that this message was sent to, except if the message was sent by the current user

fromMe.description: Indicates if the message was sent by the current user

to.description:
* ID for who this message is for.
* If the message is sent by the current user, it will be the Chat to which the message is being sent.
* If the message is sent by another user, it will be the ID for the current user.

participant.description: For groups - participant who sent the message

hasMedia.description: Indicates if the message has media available for download

mediaUrl.description: The URL for the media in the message if any

ackName.description: ACK status name for the message

author.description: If the message was sent to a group, this field will contain the user that sent the message.

location.description: Location information contained in the message, if the message is type "location"

vCards.description: List of vCards contained in the message.

_data.description: Message in a raw format that we get from WhatsApp. May be changed anytime, use it with caution! It depends a lot on the underlying backend.

filename.description: Document file name. Value can be null

mentions.description: Mention contact in the message. The message MUST contain '@123456789' text in order to work with 'mentions' field.

messageId.description: NOWEB engine only - it's important to mark ALL messages as seen

participant.description: NOWEB engine only - the ID of the user that sent the  message (undefined for individual chats)

reaction.description: Emoji to react with. Send an empty string to remove the reaction

contacts.description: it is always necessary to inform the list of contacts that will have access to the posted status
it is always necessary to inform the list of contacts that will have access to the posted status
it is always necessary to inform the list of contacts that will have access to the posted status
it is always necessary to inform the list of contacts that will have access to the posted status

chatId.description: Chat ID - either group id or contact id

participant.description: Chat ID - participant or contact id

id.description: Chat ID - either group id or contact id

event.description: Fired on all message creations, including your own.
Receive events when server or recipient gets the message, read or played it.
Its an internal engines state, not session status.
The most recent presence information for a chat.
With this event, you receive new votes for the poll sent.
There may be cases when WAHA fails to decrypt a vote from the user. Read more about how to handle such events: https://waha.devlike.pro/docs/how-to/polls/#pollvotefailed

200.description: Return a 200 status to indicate that the data was received successfully

post.summary: Fired on all message creations, including your own.

200.description: Return a 200 status to indicate that the data was received successfully

post.summary: There may be cases when WAHA fails to decrypt a vote from the user. Read more about how to handle such events: https://waha.devlike.pro/docs/how-to/polls/#pollvotefailed
